script.scene: Central Perk, everyone but Phoebe is there.

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: (entering) Hi guys!

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: Hey, Pheebs! Hi!

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: Hey. Oh, oh, how'd it go?

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: Um, not so good. He walked me to the subway and said 'We should do this again!'

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: Ohh. Ouch.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: What? He said 'we should do it again', that's good, right?

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Uh, no. Loosely translated 'We should do this again' means 'You will never see me naked'.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: Since when?

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: Since always. It's like dating language. Y'know, like 'It's not you' means 'It is you'.

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Or 'You're such a nice guy' means 'I'm gonna be dating leather-wearing alcoholics and complaining about them to you'.

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: Or, or, y'know, um, 'I think we should see other people' means 'Ha, ha, I already am'.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: And everybody knows this?

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: Yeah. Cushions the blow.

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Yeah, it's like when you're a kid, and your parents put your dog to sleep, and they tell you it went off to live on some farm.

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: That's funny, that, no, because, uh, our parents actually did, uh, send our dog off to live on a farm.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Uh, Ross.

script.scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is helping Joey rehearse for a part.

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: "So how does it feel knowing you're about to die?"

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: "Warden, in five minutes my pain will be over. But you'll have to live with the knowledge that you sent an honest man to die."

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Hey, that was really good!

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: Thanks! Let's keep going.

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Okay. "So. Whaddya want from me, Damone, huh?"

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: "I just wanna go back to my cell. 'Cause in my cell, I can smoke."

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: "Smoke away." takes a drag, and coughs.)

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: I think this is probably why Damone smokes in his cell alone.

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: What?

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Relax your hand!

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Not so much!

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: Whoah!

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Alright, now try taking a puff.

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Alright.. okay. No. Give it to me.

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: No no no, I am not giving you a cigarette.

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: It's fine, it's fine. Look, do you wanna get this part, or not? Here.

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Don't think of it as a cigarette. Think of it as the thing that's been missing from your hand. When you're holding it, you feel right. You feel complete.

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: Y'miss it?

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Nah, not so much. Alright, now we smoke. (Takes a puff.) Oh.. my.. God. (He continues to smoke.)

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: No, no, no. They say it's the same as the distance from the tip of a guy's thumb to the tip of his index finger.

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: That's ridiculous!

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: Can I use.. either thumb?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: (carrying a tray of drinks) Alright, don't tell me, don't tell me! (Starts handing them out.) Decaf cappucino for Joey.. Coffee black.. Late.. And an iced tea. I'm getting pretty good at this!

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: Yeah. Yeah, excellent.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: (leaving to serve others) Good for me!

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: Y'okay, Phoebe?

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: Yeah- no- I'm just- it's, I haven't worked- It's my bank.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: What did they do to you?

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: It's nothing, it's just- Okay. I'm going through my mail, and I open up their monthly, you know, STATEMENT-

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: Easy.

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: - and there's five hundred extra dollars in my account.

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Oh, Satan's minions at work again...

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: Yes, 'cause now I have to go down there, and deal with them.

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: What are you talking about? Keep it!

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: It's not mine, I didn't earn it, if I kept it, it would be like stealing.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: Yeah, but if you spent it, it would be like shopping!

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: Okay. Okay, let's say I bought a really great pair of shoes. Do you know what I'd hear, with every step I took? 'Not-mine. Not-mine. Not-mine.' And even if I was happy, okay, and, and skipping- 'Not-not-mine, not- not-mine, not-not-mine, not-not-mine'...

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: We're with you. We got it.

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: Okay. I'd- just- I'd never be able to enjoy it. It would be like this giant karmic debt.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: Chandler, what are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: (puling him up) Hey. Whaddya doing?

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: Oh! Oh, God!

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: What is this?!

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: I'm smoking. I'm smoking, I'm smoking.

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: Oh, I can't believe you! You've been so good, for three years!

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: And this- is my reward!

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: Hold on a second, alright? Just think about what you went through the last time you quit.

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Okay, so this time I won't quit!

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: Ohhh! Put it out!

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: All right! I'm putting it out, I'm putting it out. (He drops it in Phoebe's coffee.)

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: Oh, no! I- I can't drink this now!

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Alright. I'm gonna go change, I've got a date.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: This Alan again? How's it goin'?

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: 'S'going pretty good, y'know? It's nice, and, we're having fun.

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: So when do we get to meet the guy?

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Let's see, today's Monday... Never.

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: Oh, come on! Come on!

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: No. Not after what happened with Steve.

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: What are you talking about? We love Schhteve! Schhteve was schhexy!.. Sorry.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Look, I don't even know how I feel about him yet. Just give me a chance to figure that out.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: Well, then can we meet him?

stage_directions.direction: (Joey takes out a pack of cigarettes and a lighter.  He fumbles and drops the lighter.  Then he lights a cigarett,
[Scene, Central Perk, everyone except Phoebe and Rachel is there.]
(The gang swaps all the drinks for what they ordered as Phoebe enters.  She sits down without saying hi.)
(Chandler leans over the back of the couch out of sight.)
(Chandler tries to shrug nonchalantly but eventually he has to exhale a mouthful of smoke.)

script.scene: Iridium, Monica and Paula are at work.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: I mean, why should I let them meet him? I mean, I bring a guy home, and within five minutes they're all over him. I mean, they're like- coyotes, picking off the weak members of the herd.

dialogue.speaker: Paula
dialogue.line: Listen. As someone who's seen more than her fair share of bad beef, I'll tell you: that is not such a terrible thing. I mean, they're your friends, they're just looking out after you.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: I know. I just wish that once, I'd bring a guy home that they actually liked.

script.scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler is smoking out on the balcony, Phoebe is absent.

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: Let it go, Ross.

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: Yeah, well, you didn't know Chi Chi.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Do you all promise?

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: Yeah! We promise! We'll be good!

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: (shouts to Chandler) Chandler? Do you promise to be good?

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: You can come in, but your filter-tipped little buddy has to stay outside!

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: Hey, Pheebs.

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: 'Dear Ms. Buffay. Thank you for calling attention to our error. We have credited your account with five hundred dollars. We're sorry for the inconvenience, and hope you'll accept this- (Searches in her purse) -football phone as our free gift.' Do you believe this?! Now I have a thousand dollars, and a football phone!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: What bank is this?

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Hey. It's him. (On the intercom) Who is it?

dialogue.speaker: Alan
dialogue.line: (on the intercom) It's Alan.

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: (shouting to Chandler) Chandler! He's here!

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: (to all) Okay, please be good, please. Just remember how much you all like me.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Hi. Alan, this is everybody. Everybody, this is Alan.

dialogue.speaker: Alan
dialogue.line: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: Hi, Alan.

dialogue.speaker: Alan
dialogue.line: I've heard schho much about all you guyschh!

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: (to Alan) Thanks. I'll call you tomorrow. (Alan exits, to all) Okay. Okay, let's let the Alan-bashing begin. Who's gonna take the first shot, hmm?

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: C'mon!

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: ...I'll go. Let's start with the way he kept picking at- no, I'm sorry, I can't do this, can't do this. We loved him.

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: Loved him! Yeah! He's great!

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Wait a minute! We're talking about someone that I'm going out with?

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: Yeah!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: And did you notice...? (She spreads her thumb and index finger.) The Guys: (reluctantly) Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: Know what was great? The way his smile was kinda crooked.

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: Yes, yes! Like the man in the shoe!

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: ...What shoe?

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: From the nursery rhyme. 'There was a crooked man, Who had a crooked smile, Who lived in a shoe, For a... while...'

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: ...So I think Alan will become the yardstick against which all future boyfriends will be measured.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: What future boyfriends? Nono, I th- I think this could be, y'know, it.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Really!

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Oh, yeah. I'd marry him just for his David Hasselhof impression alone. You know I'm gonna be doing that at parties, right? (Does the impression)

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: You know what I like most about him, though?

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: What?

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: The way he makes me feel about myself.

stage_directions.direction: (Chandler makes a 'Cross my heart' sign.  It starts to rain and he taps on the window.)
(Chandler sulkilty picks up a garbage can lid and uses it as an umbrella.)
(Phoebe enters, walks to the couch, sits down, and begins to read a letter without saying hi.)
(She opens the door and Alan enters.)

script.scene: Central Perk, Monica is alone as Ross, Rachel, Chandler, and Joey enter dejectedly in softball gear.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Hi.. how was the game?

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: Well..

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: WE WON!! Thank you! Yes!

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Fantastic! I have one question: How is that possible?

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: Alan.

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: He was unbelievable. He was like that-that-that Bugs Bunny cartoon where Bugs is playing all the positions, right, but instead of Bugs it was first base-Alan, second base-Alan, third base-...

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: I mean, it-it was like, it was like he made us into a team.

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Yep, we sure showed those Hassidic jewellers a thing or two about softball..

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Can I ask you guys a question? D'you ever think that Alan is maybe.. sometimes..

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: What?

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: ..I dunno, a little too Alan?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: Well, no. That's impossible. You can never be too Alan.

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: Yeah, it's his, uh, innate Alan-ness that-that-that we adore.

script.scene: A street, Phoebe walks up to a homeless person (Lizzie) she knows.

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: Hey, Lizzie.

dialogue.speaker: Lizzie
dialogue.line: Hey, Weird Girl.

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: I brought you alphabet soup.

dialogue.speaker: Lizzie
dialogue.line: Did you pick out the vowels?

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: Yes. But I left in the Ys. 'Cause, y'know, "sometimes y". Uh, I also have something else for you. (She searches in her purse.)

dialogue.speaker: Lizzie
dialogue.line: Saltines?

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: No, but would you like a thousand dollars and a football phone?

dialogue.speaker: Lizzie
dialogue.line: What? (She opens the envelope Phoebe has given her.) Oh my God, there's really money in here.

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: I know.

dialogue.speaker: Lizzie
dialogue.line: Weird Girl, what are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: No, I want you to have it. I don't want it.

dialogue.speaker: Lizzie
dialogue.line: No, no, I ha-I have to give you something.

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: Oh, that's fine, no.

dialogue.speaker: Lizzie
dialogue.line: Would you like my tin-foil hat?

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: No. 'Cause you need that. No, it's okay, thanks.

dialogue.speaker: Lizzie
dialogue.line: Please, let me do something.

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: Okay, alright, you buy me a soda, and then we're even. Okay?

dialogue.speaker: Lizzie
dialogue.line: Okay.

script.scene: A Street, Phoebe and Lizzie are at a hot dog vendor.

dialogue.speaker: Lizzie
dialogue.line: Keep the change. (To Phoebe) Sure you don't wanna pretzel?

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: No, I'm fine.

dialogue.speaker: Lizzie
dialogue.line: (leaves) See ya.

script.scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is telling everyone about her discovery.

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: A thumb?!

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: Eww!

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: I know! I know, I opened it up and there it was, just floating in there, like this tiny little hitch-hiker!

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Well, maybe it's a contest, y'know? Like, collect all five?

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: Does, um, anyone wanna see?

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: Nooo!

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: Oh, hey, don't do that! Cut it out!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: It's worse than the thumb!

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Hey, this is so unfair!

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Oh, why is it unfair?

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: So I have a flaw! Big deal! Like Joey's constant knuckle-cracking isn't annoying? And Ross, with his over-pronouncing every single word? And Monica, with that snort when she laughs? I mean, what the hell is that thing? ...I accept all those flaws, why can't you accept me for this?

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: ...Does the knuckle-cracking bother everybody?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: Well, I-I could live without it.

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: Well, is it, like, a little annoying, or is it like when Phoebe chews her hair?

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: Oh, now, don't listen to him, Pheebs, I think it's endearing.

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: Oh, (Imitating Ross) "you do, do you"?

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: You know, there's nothing wrong with speaking correctly.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: "Indeed there isn't"... I should really get back to work.

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: Yeah, 'cause otherwise someone might get what they actually ordered.

stage_directions.direction: (They degenerate into bickering and Chandler happily starts to smoke, undisturbed.)

script.scene: Iridium, Monica and Paula are working.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Did you ever go out with a guy your friends all really like?

dialogue.speaker: Paula
dialogue.line: No.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Okay.. Well, I'm going out with a guy my friends all really like.

dialogue.speaker: Paula
dialogue.line: Waitwait.. we talking about the coyotes here? All right, a cow got through!

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Can you believe it? ...Y'know what? I just don't feel the thing. I mean, they feel the thing, I don't feel the thing.

dialogue.speaker: Paula
dialogue.line: Honey.. you should always feel the thing. Listen, if that's how you feel about the guy, Monica, dump him!

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: I know.. it's gonna be really hard.

dialogue.speaker: Paula
dialogue.line: Well, he's a big boy, he'll get over it.

script.scene: Cental Perk, Joey and Ross are persecuting Chandler about his smoking.

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: Do you have any respect for your body?

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: Don't you realise what you're-you're doing to yourself?

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Hey, y'know, I have had it with you guys and your cancer and your emphysema and your heart disease. The bottom line is, smoking is cool, and you know it.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: (holding the phone out to Chandler) Chandler? It's Alan, he wants to speak to you.

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Really? He does? (taking the phone) Hey, buddy, what's up! Oh, she told you about that, huh. Well, yeah, I have one now and then. Well, yeah, now. Well, it's not that big- ..well, that's true,.. Gee, y'know, no-one- no-one's ever put it like that before. Well, okay, thanks! (He hands the phone back and stubs out his cigarette.)

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: (to Ross, who has wandered up) God, he's good.

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: If only he were a woman.

stage_directions.direction: (They give each other a dubious look.)

script.scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyond except Monica and Joey is watching Lambchop.

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Ooh, Lambchop. How old is that sock? If I had a sock on my hand for thirty years it'd be talking too.

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: Okay. I think it's time to change somebody's nicotine patch. (Does so.)

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: (entering) Hey. Where's Joey?

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: Joey ate my last stick of gum, so I killed him. Do you think that was wrong?

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: I think he's across the hall.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Thanks. (Goes to fetch him.)

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: (finishing changing Chandler's nicotine patch) There y'go.

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: (deadpan) Ooh, I'm alive with pleasure now.

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: Hey Pheebs, you gonna have the rest of that Pop-Tart?.. Pheebs?

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: Does anyone want the rest of this Pop-Tart?

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: Hey, I might!

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: Sorry. ..Y'know, those stupid soda people gave me seven thousand dollars for the thumb.

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: You're kidding. Oh my God.

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: And on my way over here, I stepped in gum. ...What is up with the universe?!

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: (dragged in by Monica, he has just gotten out of the shower) What's going on?

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Nothing. I just think it's nice when we're all here together.

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: Even nicer when everyone gets to wear their underwear..

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: Uh, Joey..

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: Oh, God! (Hurriedly closes his legs.)

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: (turns off the TV) Okay..

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: Oh! That was Lambchop!

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Please, guys, we have to talk.

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: Wait, wait, I'm getting a deja vu...no, I'm not.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Alright, we have to talk.

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: There it is!

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Okay. It's-it's about Alan. There's something that you should know. I mean, there's really no easy way to say this.. uh.. I've decided to break up with Alan.

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: Is there somebody else?

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: No, nononono.. it's just.. things change. People change.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: We didn't change..

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: So that's it? It's over? Just like that?

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: You know.. you let your guard down, you start to really care about someone, and I just- I- (starts chewing her hair)

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Look, I- I could go on pretending-

dialogue.speaker: Joey
dialogue.line: Okay!

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: -but that wouldn't be fair to me, it wouldn't be fair to Alan- It wouldn't be fair to you!

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: Who-who wants fair? Y'know, I just want things back. Y'know, the way they were.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: I'm sorry..

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: (sarcastic) Oh, she's sorry! I feel better!

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: (tearful) I just can't believe this! I mean, with the holidays coming up- I wanted him to meet my family-

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: I'll meet somone else. There'll be other Alans.

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: Oh, yeah! Right!

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Are you guys gonna be okay?

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: Hey hey, we'll be fine. We're just gonna need a little time.

stage_directions.direction: (They all gasp and clutch each other.)

script.scene: A Restaurant, Monica is breaking the news to Alan.

dialogue.speaker: Alan
dialogue.line: Wow.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: I'm, I'm really sorry.

dialogue.speaker: Alan
dialogue.line: Yeah, I'm sorry too. But, I gotta tell you, I am a little relieved.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Relieved?

script.scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is mopping around and eating ice cream.

dialogue.speaker: Rachel
dialogue.line: Remember when we went to Central Park and rented boats?.. That was fun.

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: Yeah. He could row like a viking.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: (entering) Hi.

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: Mmm.

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: So how'd it go?

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Oh, y'know..

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: Did he mention us?

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: He said he's really gonna miss you guys. (dubious look)

dialogue.speaker: Ross
dialogue.line: You had a rough day, huh.. c'mere. (She sits down and Ross strokes her forehead.)

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: ...That's it. I'm getting cigarettes.

dialogue.speaker: All
dialogue.line: No no no!

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: (leaving) I don't care, I don't care! Game's over! I'm weak! I've gotta smoke! I've gotta have the smoke!

dialogue.speaker: Phoebe
dialogue.line: (shouting as he leaves) If you never smoke again I'll give you seven thousand dollars!

dialogue.speaker: Chandler
dialogue.line: (returns) Yeah, alright. End
